Life:
Any live cell with fewer than 2 live neighbours dies,
	 as if by underpopulation.

Any live cell with two or 3 live neighbours
	 lives on to the next generation.

Any live cell with more than 3 live neighbours dies,
	 as if by overpopulation.

Any dead cell with exactly 3 live neighbours
	 becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.
HighLife:
Any live cell with fewer than 2 live neighbours dies,
	 as if by underpopulation.

Any live cell with two or 3 live neighbours
	 lives on to the next generation.

Any live cell with more than 3 live neighbours dies,
	 as if by overpopulation.

Any dead cell with exactly 3 or 6 live neighbours
	 becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.
The Rainbow Game:
Any live cell with fewer than 2 live neighbours dies,
	 as if by underpopulation.

Any live cell with two or 3 live neighbours
	 lives on to the next generation.

Any live cell with more than 3 live neighbours dies,
	 as if by overpopulation.

Any dead cell with exactly 3 live neighbours
	 becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.

Newborn cells are colored based on the
	 average color values of their parent cells
